sender.description: The address of the entity sending packets in this test

receiver.description: The address of the entity receiving packets in this test

packet-count.description: The number of packets to send

packet-interval.description: The number of seconds to delay between sending packets

packet-timeout.description: The number of seconds to wait before declaring a packet lost

packet-padding.description: The size of padding to add to the packet in bytes

udp-ports.description: The port range to use on the side of the test running the client. At least two ports required.

ip-tos.description: DSCP value for TOS byte in the IP header as an integer

ip-version.description: Force a specific IP address type used performing the test. Useful when specifying hostnames as sender or receiver that may map to both IPv4 and IPv6 addresses.

bucket-width.description: The bin size to use for histogram calculations. This value is divided into the result as reported in seconds and truncated to the nearest 2 decimal places.

output-raw.description: Output individual packet statistics. This will substantially increase the size of a successful result.

flip.description: In multi-participant mode, have the receiver start the client and request a reverse test. Useful in some firewall and NAT environments.

single-participant-mode.description: Do not coordinate with the remote side. Useful for cases where remote side is not running pScheduler but known to have necessary daemon for test.
